result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
During the pendency of this deferral, the Defendant agrees to:
-Commit no acts which rise to the level of probable cause in violation of the criminal laws of the state of Wisconsin, or of any other state, or of the United States of America.
-Comply with all conditions of bail or bond in this case.
-Pay a fine of Fifty Dollars (50.00) in both 22CF51 and 22CF285, plus misdemeanor costs and surcharges within ninety (90) days or set up a payment plan within the Clerk of Courts.
-Comply with all conditions of probation in files 22CF51 and 22CF285 (as to Count 1). Violation of any rule of probation, or revocation from probation, constitutes a violation of this condition. 
-Pay restitution in the amount of Twelve Thousand One Hundred Ninety Dollars ($12,190.00) joint and severely with any other parties convicted in relation to the underlying incident in 22CF51, which the Defendant stipulates he or she owes in this matter, not including the 10% surcharge. The defendant will make monthly payments of $375 per month (beginning on the first month following the Court's adoption of the agreement), on the first day of every month, payable to the Douglas County Clerk of Courts.
If the defendant makes good faith efforts to pay the restitution but later encounters hardship on making scheduled payments, it is the responsibility of the defendant, either personally or through his or her attorney, to contact the District Attorney's Office at 715-395-1218 to request and extension. Failure to request an extension in this circumstance constitutes evidence that the defendant has no made good faith efforts to make scheduled payment(s). The District Attorney's Office has sole discretion whether to modify the agreed-upon payment schedule. A missed or late restitution payment constitutes a violation of this condition.

-The parties agree, and the defendant understands, that the conditions of any bail or bond in effect on the plea date shall continue for the entire length of this agreement, and that any violation of the defendant's bond may result in bail jumping charges pursuant to Wis. Stat. 946.49. The defendant further understands that a charged violation of the bail or bond for which probable cause is found shall be a basis for the State to vacate this agreement.
-Defendant will keep Douglas County Clerk of Courts informed of his address and telephone number at all times, and stipulates that the sending of notice by regular mail to the address on file with the Clerk of Courts constitutes sufficient notice of any court hearings scheduled in this matter.  The non-appearance of the defendant may result in the issuance of an arrest warrant. 
-If, at any time during the deferral period, the defendant has no complied with the conditions of this agreement, the State may at its discretion and upon notice the defendant, revoke the agreement and move the Court to enter judgment of conviction and the parties shall proceed to sentencing. At sentencing, the parties would recommend that the Court sentence the defendant, as to count 1, to one hundred eighty (180) days' jail, with credit for zero (0) days at the time of the acceptance of this agreement, concurrent to Count 2, but consecutive to 22CF51.
-Except as otherwise provided in this agreement, the State must prove non-compliance with thus agreement by the preponderance of the evidence at a hearing subject to Wis. Stat. 911.01(4)(c).
-At the end of this deferral period or upon completion of all terms of this agreement, whichever is later, if the defendant has complied with the conditions of this agreement and provided proof of compliance when required, the State will move to dismiss Count 1 22CF285.
Programming as deemed appropriate by DOC
Pay as required by Clerk of Courts.
Pay as required by Clerk of Courts.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Evan Jhonthan Charle Johnson

defendant.name: Johnson, Evan Jhonthan Charle

records.addlTxt:
1:42 PM Defendant Evan Jhonthan Charle Johnson in court.  Attorney Jamy Richard Johansen in court for Evan Jhonthan Charle Johnson.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim appears by video. Court calls case. State indicates will amend Count 1 in 22CF51. in 22cf285, will dismiss Count 3. Count 1 will be a deferred judgment.  On Count 2 recommend 90 days I&S consecutive if revoked, 2 years probation, DOC programming, court costs. On 22CF51, 90 days consecutive to 22CF285 if revoked, I&S 2 years probation, 4 days jail, 4 credit, $50 plus costs. Restitution of $12,190 joint and several with other parties. 
Court recounts charges and possible penalties in both files. Defendant pleads no contest to all counts. Court informs defendant of rights given up by their plea. Attorney stipulates to a factual basis. Court accepts the Defendant's plea and finds that the Defendant's plea has been freely, voluntarily and intelligently made. Court finds Defendant understands all the rights they are waiving by their plea. The Defendant is found guilty and Judgment of Conviction is entered. Judgment is deferred on Count 1 in 22CF285.  
State makes statements regarding sentencing. Believes reasonable resolution in this matter.
Attorney Johansen makes statements. Agrees with State. Court makes statements. 

Court orders on 22CF51, 90 days I&S 2 years, conditions 4 days, 4 credit, $50 fines plus costs, Doc programming.  $12,190 restitution. Payments of not less than 375 per month commencing 9/1/22. 
On 22CF285, count 2 90 days jail I&S, consecutive, 2 years concurrent probation. DOC programming, $50 fine plus costs.

9:30 AM Defendant Evan Jhonthan Charle Johnson in court.  Attorney Jamy Richard Johansen in court for Evan Jhonthan Charle Johnson.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Attorney asks for plea and sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman appeared by video for Evan Jhonthan Charle Johnson. Attorney Hoffman waives reading and requests preliminary on Count 1 and plead not guilty on others. State requests $1,000 cash bail and conditions of no contact with Michele Haltli, S.S. or 1108 Baxter Ave. No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. Defendant is currently out on bail for another Douglas Co case. Defendant is a lifelong resident and has family that lives locally. Court reviews open Douglas Co case and no fta's but failure to follow Court orders. Court orders $400 cash bail and conditions of no contact with Michele Haltli, S.S. or 1108 Baxter Ave. No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 09:30 am.
